subject: Re: Hi, just curious about Junit....newbie
msgSnippet: ... Sounds like a history question. No, the Java Reflection API did *NOT* inspire the creation of JUnit. The smalltalk unit testing tool from the C3 project
messageBody:
--- "jonghwanyang" <jonghwanyang@y...> wrote:
> Hi, I was wondering in what way was the Java Reflection library
> important for the creation of JUnit. Thanks...

Sounds like a history question.

No, the Java Reflection API did *NOT* inspire the creation of JUnit.
The smalltalk unit testing tool from the C3 project inspired the
creation of JUnit. Smalltalk has more a powerful metadata query and
manipulation ability than Java. But Java provides sufficient
functionality to build a useful tool. And, amended with appropriate
directory searching tools, one can even find the test classes.
